I enjoyed playing Support Ornn, before he was usually banned every game. One of his strongest strengths was being able to block blitzcrank grabs with his W, as well as countering other displacement support/jungle champions (Alistar/Lee Sin/Nautilus). With this W change, drop in late game power with ult cooldown increase, and the removal of face of the mountain's active (an important item for support Ornn to protect ADC's from single target burst), I'm not sure it's worth playing Support Ornn anymore. 

Ornn's W ability to resist displacement was what gave him the ability to counter certain support champions to help his early game support weaknesses in lane. He just feels like a clunkier Nautilus, Alistar, or Leona in the early game bot lane now. It was hard enough to survive the lane phase as Ornn. I'd prefer other number nerfs than the removed counterplay ability of his W.

I didn't use my W properly to dodge CC as I don't have experience but the raw power of the spell just straight up overpowered my opposition. Making it irrelevant that I don't have practice with the champion.
But from what I understand you can displace him out of his W now?
Maybe if they added that skill expression to his E, and lowered the damage on W?

So, one question: You're removing Ruby Sightstone, but not adding a way to get the 10% Item CDR that was on it.

Can we get an option that brings that back? It's a huge deal when it comes to champions that use a lot of actives (like Redemption, Locket, etc.).

Number one, as someone who actually loves Ruby Sightstone, it's 20% and not 10%. It's also really cancerous in combination with the new runes. If you run Domination's Ingenious Hunter, you can get 40s cd Frost Queen Claim and 55s cd Redemption, making the items doubly as powerful as they were intended to be. It's just that now you can stack it that people realize how busted having such low cooldowns on actives are. 

In my opinion, Ingenious Hunter is already Ruby Sightstone being "added back", both being together is really cancer.

You know what I find is actually bullshit? Where's our Shurelya's active or FQC active now? Both items were cut out with nothing actually being put back in place for two very strong actives.

so now i have to spec domination if i want a boost to my locket/redemption cd? that locks me out of font of life and revitalize, which doesn't feel like an INCREASE in autonomy at all.

this change feels really really bad, riot. please put item cd % on boots or reduce the base cooldowns or something.

With all due respect guys... if the concern is "letting champions like Alistar or Leona run wild in early duels against marksmen" how on Earth is giving them an extra flat 70 MR/armor at level 1 going to stop that?  You've just made them completely unkillable.  

A level 1 Leona is going to walk into lane with 47 base + 70 aftershock armor.  Level 1, she will have 117 armor against a marksman with a +8 damage Doran's Blade.  If she waits until level 3 to get her W, that's still giving her a minimum of 52.3 base + 76 aftershock + 45 eclipse armor.  She is going to have her full combo and 173.3 armor, with no armor items.  And that's without any armor she might get if she runs Iron Skin instead of Conditioning.  

How is this supposed to stop her from running wild? If anything, it looks like you gave her the ability to run even wilder, anywhere, anytime.

the change is good because the 70 armor at lvl 1 only lasts for 2.5 seconds. leona and alistar will have less burst but be tankier for the duration. sounds better to me cause im going to focus the squishies anyways. and if the squishies kite backwards or get away, the support will have lost their aftershock resistances already.

keep in mind that for aftershock to go off, the champion has to cc someone first, and its a 20sec cd so i think it gives enough time to make a play against them. its still tank cc meta anyways so just stay away from them in the first place

The aftershock damage has never really been a problem, at least not from what I've experienced.  And I'm a Sona main, and you can't get much squishier than that.  But the problem is that this 2.5 seconds of being utterly unkillable is enough for them to turret-dive at level 1.  If you don't believe me, make a custom match, go flash stun the enemy champ under their turret and walk away with your aftershock armor.  It doesn't matter if you blow your flash level 1 if you/your adc gets a level 1 kill and snowballs the lane from there.  What counterplay is there with the TURRET can't even kill them in the space that they and their adc can kill you?  When even hiding under the turret doesn't make you safe.  

Oh, and that 117 armor that Leona will have at level 1 is over 4 times the amount of armor that Sona has.

As somebody who plays support, these changes are absolute _garbage_. The passive item quests were a step in the right direction, it helped supports fulfill the role they were suppposed to do: Tanks had a bit more protection, poke supports were able to trade better, and healers could more easily help their teammates with the movespeed buff. I find these changes are going to hit tank supports worst of all, though. On top of gutting Resolve's health bonus (unless you take Inspiration as your second tree but it's not exactly fair to force every tank support to take Inspiration or get lost), you take away the shield passive AND sightstone (not to mention ruby sightstone). Meanwhile, you guys at Rito HQ think it's a good idea to tie vision to farming? Offensive supports are going to just nuke the tanks that no longer have the protection they used to have, which forces them out of lane. While lets the other team farm more, which gives _the snowballing lane_ a vision advantage? What are we supposed to do to that? When you're playing from behind now at least you could grab sightstone a bit earlier, get some defensive vision out. Now that option is completely gone. The losing lane also loses their ability to give vision to their team while the winning lane has every possible advantage and can snowball even harder than before. Which these changes I might just quit playing support altogether if botlanes are going to be nothing but "Support" Luxes and Brands etc. That only get the one support item and build full AP, and are then _rewarded_ with a vision advantage. Botlane is going to be a complete bloodbath, mark my words.

I hope these changes get reverted ASAP or else Riot just lost a support player. I'm glad I've been practicing other roles

I have to agree, I don’t really think removing unstoppable on Ornn’s W is the proper course of action. I don’t play Ornn, I agree fully he is too strong in his current state and that the R CD being raised is a good course of action. But changing his W in this way is encouraging a dps playstyle over a tankier route for Ornn players, and I’m not sure why that was the choice. He’ll lose a lot of survivability against other tops with CC, but still retain his damage potential? I believe Ornn is better served as a utility champ for his team, meaning I would rather see slick play of his W and ult, at the cost of his DPS. A fundamental part of his kit (unstoppable) could be retained for skilled play, and his damage lowered on either his fire spout or the damage done from his brittle passive or even both. 

Iunno, maybe I’m alone in this opinion. A buddy of mine plays Ornn and we’ve spoken about it at length. I’m not sure why being a bruiser is pushed over the unique qualities of his kit, but I admit I’m curious to see the effect it has.

I’ve always performed very well with Jinx, but over the last few years I’ve had to adopt a far more tentative playstyle with her because even if I’m 10/2, there are a few adcs Jinx just has a hard time against 1v1. As an ADC main, I’m glad to see Vayne/Ez nerfed.

I'm sorry Rito but why do you have to be "fixing" things that don't need to be fixed? You want to fix something in bot lane? Fix Draven's damage or Twitch and Vayne's insane scaling. Don't take away vital support items. I understand that you're trying to make it cheaper and faster for supports to get SSs but completely taking out active items is not the answer, this coming from a support main. I am CONSTANTLY using my Talisman on Rakan or Nami to remove my teammates from bad situations or help them catch an escaping low health enemy. Constantly use Frost Queen's on Sona and Lulu to reveal nearby areas for safety  or to slow down low health champs for my team. I like the idea of making SS less of a hassle to get with other items early game but taking out the essential support items is a stupid idea unless you plan on replacing them quickly with similar items. A lot of supports use the active item procs like Talisman and get a Ruby SS for the vision side. Actually, most supports I know take the active item over the sight item and grab a Ruby SS to compensate for vision. PLUS, Ruby SS has a CDR stat that lets you use all of your active items (what true supports thrive on to sustain their team) much faster, so they're up by every team fight. It really feels like you're trying to push real supports farther out of the meta and bring in more largely damage based AP supports like Lux, Brand, Xerath, etc. (which really arent supports at all, just over glorified midlaners) Supports were fine as is, if you wanted to adjust the SS acquisition rate, you should have messed solely with sightstones or just reduced their gold price or something, what you SHOULDN'T have done was take out vital early items lol

Removing support items is a huge issue. One of the most frustrating aspect of League at the moment is the lack of meaningful decisions. For example the build paths for ADCs are atrociously stale. Removing support items is just removing decisions that can differentiate player skill. In this case the decision was to buy the support item with sightstone separate but spend more gold, or forfeit the active item for the combination item while spending less gold.
I'm very disappointed with this change. League really needs more items for every role, otherwise building items is becoming more of a chore than a mechanic.
